dmca.title: my banner is stolen by one of your clients!!!
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Studio [mailto:studio@fashionpoint.co.uk] 
Sent: Wednesday, January 10, 2007 11:33 AM
To: Copyright
Subject: my banner is stolen by one of your clients!!!

Dear Abuse Dept.,

Today I found out that one of your clients has stolen my banner and
using it.

Here is his info:
1. URL: http://flexgirls.thumblogger.com/ 2. IP: 69.57.144.70

On the screenshot1.jpg you can clearly see that the link in banner's
"element properties" leads to my website which is
www.fashionpoint.co.uk.
The banner which I'm talking about is circled in RED in screenshot1.jpg.
But if you click on that link browser will take you to
http://flexgirls.thumblogger.com which is not my website at all! The guy
just stole my banner!! Please take some measures - this is your clients
taking hosting from you.  He uses my intellectual property without my
permission!
